title: How to Stop a Cake from Browning Too Much

steps.title: Check that the cake pan is deep enough for the cake.
steps.content: Check that the cake pan is deep enough for the cake. A shallow pan carries more risk of browning than a deep one.

steps.title: Line the sides of the cake pan.
steps.content: Line the sides of the cake pan. Use two layers of brown paper and two layers of baking paper. [1] X Research source Allow this paper to extend above the pan about 5 centimeter (2.0 in) to 7 centimeter (2.8 in). This paper "wall" will help to protect the cake top from browning.

steps.title: Smooth the cake before adding it to the oven.
steps.content: Smooth the cake before adding it to the oven. A flatter surface made by a spatula or knife can help to prevent uneven browning. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Check the alignment of the oven shelves.
steps.content: Check the alignment of the oven shelves. The shelf used should not place the cake too close to the heat source. Bake the cake in the lower half of the oven.

steps.title: Keep an eye on the cake as it bakes.
steps.content: Keep an eye on the cake as it bakes. If it appears to be browning unevenly, turn it in quarters several times during baking. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Add a layer of kitchen foil.
steps.content: Add a layer of kitchen foil. Halfway through baking, you can place a layer of kitchen foil over the top of the cake to prevent browning, especially where it has a fruit or caramelized top. [4] X Research source
